fields.description:
Problem Description:

Support typically gets a handful of cases per month whereby users are accessing JIRA remotely from a windows box and are attempting to load a local XML backup but don't realize the backup must be on the remote JIRA instance (Eg. local to the JIRA installation) and can't restore the backup. I'd say there is a much larger number of customers who do figure it out but are inconvenienced for some period of time. 


Currently it says
{code}
Restoring data from a backup XML file into JIRA is simple.

   1. To restore from a file, enter the filename below.
   2. Specify a unique index location for this instance of JIRA.

WARNING: This will wipe all existing JIRA content - make sure you backup first!
Note 1: You will be logged out after the restore process. Make sure you know your login details in the data being restored.
Note 2: The restore process can take a few minutes. Please be patient. 
{code}

I think we should add a caveat to 2) whereby we more clearly specify that the backup must be loaded locally and relative to the physical instance of JIRA and not the workstation currently accessing JIRA.
fields.summary: import / export page needs to more clearly specify where the backup file must be located

fields.description: I added the Road Map portlet to my dashboad which is very useful. But when we finish a release version, we need to move on to the next one. The Road Map display on my dashboard continues to display all the previous versions of all selected projects from the first day I added the porlet to my dashboard. Is this a bug or is there a way to remove all the release versions that are older than today? Otherwise, the list of old verisons will continue to grow and this portlet will become unusable.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-16029].
  {panel}

The user browser's auto-complete feature is great, but can be even better. I propose improving it (along with a setting) to enable searching users based on their properties. A simple use case could be that we have an additional username (or say why not a phone number) attached to the user as a property. When selecting a user using the auto-complete functionality one would want to be able to use these properties when searching a user.

Say John Smith (jsmith) has a phone number defined using the property "phoneNumber" with a value "12345". When searching for him using the auto-complete feature, one could use any of the following (the last one being the new feature):
John
Smith
jsm
123

This should be relatively easy to implement, as this only requires adding a bit of code to the DefaultUserPickerSearchService's userMatches function. The user object is already fetched so we already have the properties in the object.

Adding a setting to enable/disable searching these properties would require a bit more coding but would still be fairly trivial to implement.
fields.summary: Search user properties when searching a user with the user auto-completion functionality

fields.description:
Hi Guys,

In *Kaamelot Plugin*, I provided 2 Portlets with different Configuration but with the same rendering.
 
Under *JIRA 3.10*, I declared the thumbnail using file-server Servlet with *download/resources*.

Declarations was as follow :
{code:xml}
	<resource type="download" name="fastworklog" location="portlets/dashboard/thumbnails/fastworklog.png" />
	<resource type="download" name="corner_fastworklog" location="portlets/dashboard/thumbnails/corner_fastworklog.png" />

	<webwork1 key="Actions" name="Actions Added" class="java.lang.Object">
		...
	</webwork1>

	<portlet key="fast-worklog-on-request" name="Fast WorkLog" class="com.atlassian.jira.portal.portlets.FastWorklogPortletOnRequest">
		...
		<thumbnail>download/resources/jira.plugin.kaamelot.core:Actions/fastworklog</thumbnail>
		...
	</portlet>

	<portlet key="fast-worklog" name="Fast WorkLog" class="com.atlassian.jira.portal.portlets.FastWorklogPortlet">
		...
		<thumbnail>download/resources/jira.plugin.kaamelot.core:Actions/fastworklog</thumbnail>
		...
	</portlet>
{code}

Since *JIRA 3.13* (perhaps 3.11 or 3.12, I do not have verified), the usage of file-server Servlet for thumbnail seems to be forced (See [KAAM-260|http://developer.atlassian.com/jira/browse/KAAM-260]).
Then, I modified declarations as follow :  
{code:xml}
	<resource type="download" name="fastworklog" location="portlets/dashboard/thumbnails/fastworklog.png" />
	<resource type="download" name="corner_fastworklog" location="portlets/dashboard/thumbnails/corner_fastworklog.png" />

	<portlet key="fast-worklog-on-request" name="Fast WorkLog" class="com.atlassian.jira.portal.portlets.FastWorklogPortletOnRequest">
		...
		<thumbnail>portlets/dashboard/thumbnails/fastworklog.png</thumbnail>
		...
	</portlet>

	<portlet key="fast-worklog" name="Fast WorkLog" class="com.atlassian.jira.portal.portlets.FastWorklogPortlet">
		...
		<thumbnail>portlets/dashboard/thumbnails/fastworklog.png</thumbnail>
		...
	</portlet>
{code}

In practical, it is more easy for my plugin and any others, but in details, more with coming *Plugin Version 2*, we lost possibility to extend a module of an existing plugin in another plugin.

Imagine that my Portlets was provided twi different Plugins, it would be useful to share some resource ! 
Do you agree ?

Then, is there a way to define explcitely that a ressources is or not embedded in current plugin.

Vincent
fields.summary: Thumbnails and Resources in Plugins

fields.description:
One of our customers answered to JIRA notification using e-mail seemingly with a binary data (attachment?) (see ). Then when we in Atlassian Connector retrieve all issues matching some filter (with $applicationContext/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/temp/SearchRequest.xml) we get XML file which contains XML entities (escaped characters) which are invalid in XML 1.0, and valid only in XML 1.1 - e.g. https://studio.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/10674/SearchRequest-10021.xml

My quick research showed that XML 1.1 was not really widely adopted (e.g. newest FireFox and Opera browsers, Java JDOM) don't parse correctly XML 1.1 files.
Only IE and J-Xerces passed my tests.

People in the industry (e.g. [here|http://osdir.com/ml/java.jdom.general/2006-07/msg00030.html] claim that it's better to stick to XML 1.0 whenever we can and generally than XML 1.1 is a new unnecessary standard.

I think that JIRA should generate valid XML 1.0 instead of XML 1.1 files.
Quick dive into JIRA sources revealed that responsible code for escaping characters in search request XMLs is [here| https://svn.atlassian.com/atlaseye/browse/atlassian/atlassian-core/trunk/src/main/java/com/atlassian/core/util/XMLUtils.java?r=40067#l162]. 

One more thing: JIRA does not include proper 
{code:xml}
<?xml version="1.1" ?>
{code}
header in generated XMLs, so anyway such data by default will be parsed as XML version 1.0 which fails (even with Xerces).

You may refer to real scenario at https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/PL-863
fields.summary: XML output from SearchRequest contains XML entities valid only in XML 1.1

fields.description:
This is something that we first noticed in the stream plugin and first raised as: http://developer.atlassian.com/jira/browse/STRM-156

After doing some investigation it turns out that it's more of a problem with JAC returning the filename from the database for an attachment containing funny characters somewhat wrong.  http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TST-14324 has an attachment with the name '/nick/skitch/Terminal_—_java_—_244x71-20080516-130901.skitch.jpg'.  For some reason the long dashes seem to get garbled when that filename is read from the database, and the file can't be found on disk.

I couldn't re-produce this problem on my local instance running the latest 3.13 branch.  It could be database related.  JAC's running postgres 8.1.11, whereas I was running 8.2.3.

fields.description:
To reproduce this issue, you need to have two projects (A and B) and a user with a permission scheme with 'Resolved Issues' permission on project A, and on project B this permission is not granted.

In that case, the user can create an issue with a fix version in project A, and if he clones and moves this issue to project B, the cloned issue will have a fix version equal to its parent issue, even if this version is not existing in project B.

It should be better to remove the fix version during the move to avoid misunderstandings.
fields.summary: Fix version is not modified after a move depending on permissions

fields.description:
URLs in fields are automatically converted to hyperlinks by JIRA.  If the URL also contains 2 (or more) valid issue keys, it gets garbled.

Examples of such broken URLs are:

http://foo.example.com/?foo=TST-16650&bar=TST-16650
http://foo.example.com/TST-16650/TST-16650/index.html

Note that this bug only affects the Default Text Renderer; the Wiki Style Renderer is unaffected.

Since jira.atlassian.com is using the Wiki Style Renderer, you can see the problem by viewing the change history of the bug instead.
fields.summary: Auto-generated hyperlinks are broken if they contain more than one issue number

fields.description:
h3. Problem
In our product development environment, we use JIRA to manage our product roadmap and release plans, as well as the bi-weekly scrums that developers are actively involved in. Typically, the roadmap and release plans are written in the language of the business domain, and the issues worked on in a scrum will break those issues down into technical jargon.

One of the difficulties we have is that the development team may create 15-20 subtasks representing the detailed work they need to do to accomplish one of our release-level features.  For the rest of our organization, however, these subtasks represent issues that are not understood and would rather not be known when reviewing our roadmaps, our version history, etc. 

The subtasks vastly outnumber the business features and really clog up the system for most users.

h3. Possible solution
A natural solution would be to use security levels to hide the subtasks from all users except for the project roles that need to see them (development, QA, possibly Product Management).  

h3. Workarounds
Existing workarounds are available (putting subtasks in separate versions, separate projects, lower priorities, etc.) but all of these are cumbersome at best and not very fool-proof..
fields.summary: Ability to set the security level on a subtask

fields.description:
I've been creating tickets with custom fields and have found some inconsistent behaviour in the getSingularObjectFromString method.  My understanding is that a String is passed and it should parse/whatever the String and return a value that can be set on the field.  Consider the folllowing code:

                   Object v = customField.getCustomFieldType().getSingularObjectFromString(inputString);
                   issueObject.setCustomFieldValue(customField, v);           
                   Map fields = new HashMap();
                   fields.put("issue", issueObject);
                  GenericValue issue = ManagerFactory.getIssueManager().createIssue(reporter, fields);

This works perfectly correctly when the custom field is a text or date field, but when it's a multi select then the following stack trace is produced when the ticket is created:

java.lang.ClassCastException: java.lang.String cannot be cast to java.util.Collection
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.MultiSelectCFType.createValue(MultiSelectCFType.java:145)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.CustomFieldImpl.createValue(CustomFieldImpl.java:575)
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.issue.IssueCreateFunction.execute(IssueCreateFunction.java:85)
	at com.opensymphony.workflow.AbstractWorkflow.executeFunction(AbstractWorkflow.java:869)
	at com.opensymphony.workflow.AbstractWorkflow.transitionWorkflow(AbstractWorkflow.java:1265)
	at com.opensymphony.workflow.AbstractWorkflow.initialize(AbstractWorkflow.java:618)

The problem is MultiSelectCFType.getSingularObjectFromString which returns the given String and not the given String in a list, which is what's expected by MultiSelectCFType.createValue.  Therefore, simply alter the method to return a list:

    return Arrays.asList(s);

And the problem goes away.
fields.summary: MultiSelectCFType.getSingularObjectFromString returns incorrect object

fields.description:
JIRA does not escape the schema name stored in the entityengine.xml file. This can lead to SQL Errors if the schema name contains special characters. 

Steps to recreate:

# create a schema such as {{jira-schema}} 
# set the schema to {{jira-schema}} in entityengine.xml
# start JIRA

In the case above with the schema name as jira-schema JIRA will throw SQL Exceptions {{java.sql.SQLException: Incorrect syntax near '-'.}} when it tires to create the tables for JIRA. 

The workaround is to manually escape the schema name in the entityengine.xml file. In the case of SQL Server 2005 you simply enter {{[jira-schema]}}
fields.summary: JIRA does not escape database schema when it contains special characters
Mantis importer duplicates some log messages

fields.description:
At the moment the issue created event for a sub-task is being generated before the link to the parent issue is created.

This means that the issue listeners do not know the sub-tasks id. We can put the parent issue's id into the issue created event as a param.

A better (proper) fix for this would be to implement JRA-9358. However, that change would be more work and more infrastructure changes.
fields.summary: Issue created event for a sub-task should pass through the id of the parent issue

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

- import a backup to a currently running instance and specify a new index directory
- JIRA will create the new directory, populate the index, and then delete the old index _comments_ and _issues_ directories. The _plugins_ directory remains. 

In the logs is evidence that JIRA is attempting to delete 
{quote}2008-11-11 17:16:17,317 http-8080-Processor22 ERROR [atlassian.jira.util.FileFactory] Unable to delete directory /tmp/jira/plugins{quote} (/tmp/jira/ is the original index)

This is especially concerning for environments where production and development staging instances are hosted on the same box
fields.summary: Importing a backup while specifying a new index directory still deletes the old one

fields.description: The different types of schemes available in JIRA are often confusing to new users. Perhaps it might be handy to produce a diagram that shows how each relates to each other to aid understanding. There are currently text descriptions, but its difficult to get a conceptual overview of the different types of schemes.
fields.summary: Create graphical representation of the relationships between different schemes

fields.description:
We migrated from Bugzilla to Jira for our internal issue tracking in our IT department.
One feature of Bugzilla which we sorely miss, is when an issue is updated in bugzilla, on the next screen, it will show you who was notified about the issue.
We would like an option to do this in Jira.

I know we can see the watch list, but I would like it to show everyone who was notified, including notification rules.

Currently users are not sure if the right people got notified or not, so they follow up each issue change with emails. This is a major time drain and defeats the purpose of an issue tracking system with notifications... if users are sure who is getting notified, they need to use email so they are sure.  It should be displayed on the page without having to click anything.

This can be a global option to turn on or off, since some sites might not want this...

Thanks!
Chris Hyzer
fields.summary: show the user who was contacted due to issue update

fields.description:
For pair-programming it would be handy, that both developers are able to track their time in JIRA without the need to logout/login again. Therefore it would be nice to have a userpicker, which is filled with the current username, on the CreateWorklog-Screen. This would increase the probability, that *both* developers are actually tracking their time.
A nice side-effect would be, that someone can log work by order of someone else.
fields.summary: Choose different User, when creating a worklog

fields.description:
Currently the Attachments feature of Jira only allows a singluar Attachements location to be configured.  This is applied system wide.

We however use Filesystem quotas and different departments use Jira for Multiple Projects.  We woudl therefore like to be able to configure the Attachements location on a Per-project basis.  This would allow attachements fo specific projects to be located on different servers, in different offices.
fields.summary: Configure the Attachements Location on a Per-Project Basis.

fields.description:
Upgrading from 3.7.2 and before may produce the following error messages. 

2008-11-11 20:54:24,553 http-8090-Processor3 INFO [jira.upgrade.tasks.UpgradeTask_Build232] Lossy subscription converted for user [ccho].  No matching searchrequest could be found. No e-mail will be sent to user. Please run the Integrity checker 'Check for invalid subscriptions'

This can mean one of two things:

# The database indeed does not have the associated SearchRequest (good).
# The subscription is to a shared, but valid filter. This is wrong. 

The UpgradeTask_Build232 uses the SearchRequestService.getFilter(ctx, filterId) method. This method return null for valid shared filters until after UpgradeTask_Build319 runs. 

I believe the upgrade of the subscription works, its just the notification e-mail that fails.
fields.summary: Unable to send warning e-mails about subscriptions during upgrade from 3.7.2 to 3.13.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-15925].
  {panel}

This is the code included in the issue create template for text emails:
#if ($issue.getPriorityObject() && $issue.getPriorityObject().getId() != $constantsManager.getDefaultPriority().getString("id"))
>$stringUtils.leftPad($i18n.getText("issue.field.priority"), $padSize): $issue.getPriorityObject().getNameTranslation($i18n)
#end

The "$issue.getPriorityObject().getId() != $constantsManager.getDefaultPriority().getString("id"))" does not exist in the HTML mail template.  Incoming emails for issues set at the default priority level do not show such priority level in the message body/text.  Please consider removing the "$issue.getPriorityObject().getId() != $constantsManager.getDefaultPriority().getString("id"))" condition from the issuecreated.vm template
fields.summary: Text emails include a condition not to display issue priority value.  This should not be the case.

fields.description:
I want to build a JIRA client in .NET. I want to interface with JIRA SOAP Service to create issues, update issues and serach issues dynamically.

By exploring the SOAP Service it provides create and update remote calls.
However, the Search method is limited as one cant provide parameters for search dynamically to it. (There is no answer to JRA-7626).

My question is, if there is no remote/dynamic searching available, do i need to write a JIRA plug-in (in JAVA) for it. Is it a feasible option.

Thanks,
Farrukh
fields.summary: Searching Issues Remotely (using SOAP-RPC Service)
Users can have usernames that cause weird things to happen

fields.description:
If I try to log work on an issue that is closed, I get the following error:

You can not edit the comment as the issue is in a non-editable workflow state.

I wasn't trying to edit a comment, it is the wrong error message.  Of course, the attached screenshot I got by hacking the URL, but this is more of a problem in JIRA Studio where we are allowing users to log time worked on issues via SVN commit messages (which is how I discovered the issue).  If logging time fails, the user that made the commit is emailed with the error message, and giving them the above error message would be quite confusing.  I would also imagine this might be a problem for the SOAP service.
fields.summary: Incorrect error message when validating worklog creation for closed issues

fields.description:
We had a support case where a user running JIRA EAR/WAR was finding that everytime they deployed the WAR their logo would disappear. This was because they were making changes directly into the directory where the application server (Tomcat in this case) expanded the WAR. 

http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/config_overview.html reads

{quote}The build.xml file is an Ant file, which when invoked with the build.(sh|bat) script, will construct a deployable webapp. build.xml does this by copying the contents of the webapp/ directory, and overwriting it with the contents of edit-webapp/. Thus, never edit files in the webapp/ directory!. *If a file needs editing, first copy it from webapp/path/to/file to edit-webapp/path/to/file, and edit it there*.{quote}

I think this should be updated to include an additional note that any plugins / images etc must be built directly into the WAR in the same manner, and a warning to never edit anything directly on the server.
fields.summary: Include warning in EAR/WAR documentation not to edit anything directly on the application server

fields.description:
When critical errors occur, stack traces are shown to end users. This upsets some administrators because information about the server is revealed and is a possible security issue. It might be worthwhile having this as a configurable option in JIRA. 

A possible workaround is to edit the 500page.jsp file to remove stacktraces, but this does require someone with Java development expertise and Atlassian do not support this. Additionally this could cause crucial information to be lost from the logs which could hamper Atlassian support staff from diagnosing any problems you may have. Any changes are at your own risk.
fields.summary: Stack traces should not be shown to end uses

fields.description:
If a user doe snot have permission to see a portlet BUT they have a portlet configuration from a pervious time when they DID have permission then they can still do some portlet configuration actions such as moving it around.

Under the design principle of "no dead ends" we should fix this up.

For an example see  JRA-15535
fields.summary: Portlets the require special permission can still be "administered" via the portlet configuration screens

fields.description:
When users signup for an account at support.atlassian.com or jira.atlassian.com they get the password sent by email in clear text. This is a security breach, as the email may be intercepted by a third party and used to log in into their accounts. Moreover, many customers will use the same username/password in several systems/applications, so the compromised credentials can give access to other critical systems.

In my opinion, the signup page should have a check box "Send Password Email:" as the Administration window for creating users. That way, users concern about their password being sent over email could have the option of not receiving an email with their passwords.
fields.summary: Check box in signup window

fields.description: Workflow Transition Steps should be configurable for display order.  Often you may have 3 or more workflows and there is a "best" order to display them in.  It would be nice to allow us to order them.  Currently you have to delete all the workflow transition and re-enter them in the order you want them displayed.  This is really time consuming when you add in setting security levels, etc.
fields.summary: Workflow Transition Steps should be configurable for display order.

fields.description: If a non existent group has been given a permission on the global permissions page (for example, if the group once existed in an external provider but then was deleted), and you try to delete the permission for that group, an error is returned saying that the group does not exist, and the error message is positioned above the drop down box for selecting groups to add.
fields.summary: Cannot revoke global permissions from non existent groups
Unwatching an issue is very slow

fields.description:
It's very inconvenient each time to browse all comments to read the history, especially when history is quite long.
Usually I am interested in most recent comment history, in few latest comments only.
Same as it's organized in forums/blogs - most recent record goes first.
To make it backward compatible, new setting can be added - *Chronological Order of Comments*.
fields.summary: Back chronological order of comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-15907].
  {panel}

Would like to collect and display usage statistics.  Who is using system and when.   This would be to justify use of system to management.  Would like to show numbers as to how many are actually using the system.

5/7/09  Here is an example of a script used to create statistics information on confluence users:
There are no access_logs for confluence. However searching the apache access_log on the proxy shows following for september: 
grep '\/confluence\/login\.action' fchssl-access_log.1|wc -l 
   4633 

There may be a combination of GET and POST with login for Confluence. 
Thus one would have to cut count about in half. 
grep 'GET' temp.txt|wc -l 
   2662 

For jira, it appears that we could get login stats - ie. how many login - by counting number of calles to login.jsp in the access log for tomcat. 
grep '\/jira\/login\.jsp' access_log.2008-05-*|wc -l 
4564 

Ideally we could get statistics from a table with a sql statement such as :
select count(distinct(username)), to_char(calltime,'Mon YYYY') 
 from apache_access 
where calltime>to_date('1-01-2009','MM-DD-YYYY') 
and responsecode not in (302,404) 
group by to_char(calltime,'Mon YYYY') 

So, we'd be recording call-time, username, response code (http response code for call), etc.  If there were other types of calls that the site allows, such as calls to perl or php routines or python, etc., you could have a 'url' column, and add to the query a select on the type of ur.
Example:
...
and url like '%.php%'
...
Sample Output:
                      587 Apr 2009 
                     1480 Feb 2009 
                     1500 Jan 2009 
                     1459 Mar 2009 



and responsecode not in (302,404)
fields.summary: collect and display usage statistics

fields.description:
In the old system my users had a list of filters they could see from, when they try to find these filters in the new 3.13 system (click filters in the upper left hand screen by logout) they are no longer seeing the filters that I have assigned to the group they are in.

I have had to explain that the user now needs to go to manage filters and search on the group the filters are in.  Then the filter will show up so they can be marked as favourites.

The problem here is we are not dealing with one or two engineers who only need access to one project.

We have 700 plug engineers 1400 total users in jira who may have need to touch 4 to 10 projects in a day.

1. They don't have time to go into each new group that gets created (in the passed (3.12.3) the lead was able to have the JIRA admin create the group and put users in it.  Then he could add the filters and the users would not need to know the group or have any issues with seeing the filters.  You have now made it harder to administer the filters because now the user needs to know the group before he can add the filter to his favourites.  
2. issue 1 doesn't even take in the fact that they could see the filters in 3.12.3 and can't in the upgrade.  i.e. the upgrade didn't add those filters into his favourites list.

Suggested solutions (and there really does need to be a solution to this and I would assume quickly)

1. Create another tab in the manage filters screen that shows up with the "Favourites, my, popular, and search" that is called something like, "Filters I have rights to"  in this screen do a search on the DB for all filters the user has rights to in JIRA and allow the user to add to favourites from this screen.  

2. allow the search to search on all groups the user belongs to to give the same info that is in #1.  (But I think from a user perspective, because the filters no longer show up in the filter screen, #1 is the better solution.
fields.summary: New Favourites and Filter sharing is incomplete and broke fuctionality in the transition from 3.12.3 to 3.13

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-15900].
  {panel}


Regression of JRA-1495
version update: affects 5.1.8 and 5.2.2

Currently, in order to share a filter or dashboard with a specific project role, the user must be in that project role.  This means that a project administrator cannot create shared items for a project role unless they are also in that project role.

This should also apply to groups.  Currently, a user can only share filters with groups that they're a member of.  This should respect the 'Browse Users' global permission and if the user has this permission show all groups in the system.
fields.summary: As an Admin I want the ability to share the visibility of a filter with Groups and Roles that I am not a member of

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-15897].
  {panel}

Hello!

We develop our internal management system at the company I work, and it has Jira intergration.
Last Friday we upgraded to the newest version of Jira and found out that one very nice feature doesn't work anymore: retrieving user's open issues.

It took us some time to find out that the problem is that the getSavedFilters method from the JiraSoapService has been deprecated and only returns the user's favourite filters, hence all our users must mark this filter as favourite which is quite annoying from the user perspective.

I don't understand why the removal of a service to retrieve all filters.
Is it possible to have a service like this again?

Thanks.
fields.summary: Add service to retrieve all Jira Filters

fields.description:
If one IS NOT granted the _Bulk Change_ global permission, but is able to construct an URL that refers to the bulk operation page (for e.g.: http://localhost:8080/secure/views/bulkedit/BulkEdit1!default.jspa?reset=true) , this person can gain access to the wizard.
She/he be able to go through the wizard to the confirmation in the Step 4. Finally, in this step on the confirmation the validation of the permission is performed and user receives 404 page.

Perhaps, we should implement the validation on all steps of the wizard to avoid similar issues.
fields.summary: Missing permission validation in bulk operation wizard
